item.title: Senators in final bid to derail certification of Biden's victory
item.description: Ted Cruz and 10 others say they want a commission to investigate unsubstantiated fraud allegations.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi and Mitch McConnell's homes vandalised
item.description: Vandals spraypaint House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Senate majority leader Mitch McConnell's homes.

item.title: Coronavirus: India approves vaccines from Bharat Biotech and Oxford/AstraZeneca
item.description: It aims to inoculate some 300m people this year in one of the world's largest vaccination campaigns.

item.title: Veteran US broadcaster Larry King 'in hospital with Covid'
item.description: The 87-year-old reporter has been in a Los Angeles hospital for over a week, US media report.

item.title: Racism in ballet: Black dancer's 'humiliation' at racist comments
item.description: Chloé Lopes Gomes says she has faced humiliating racial harassment while being a ballet dancer in Berlin.

item.title: Suspected Islamists kill dozens in attacks on two Niger villages
item.description: The government said soldiers had been sent to protect the area, close to Niger's border with Mali.

item.title: Norway landslide: More bodies found as rescuers search Gjerdrum site
item.description: Four bodies have now been recovered following the landslide that destroyed homes in Ask village.

item.title: DR Congo pardons two men over President Kabila assassination
item.description: The pardons come amid a rift between President Félix Tshisekedi and his predecessor, Kabila's son.

item.title: Bitcoin value surges past $30,000 (£22,000) for first time
item.description: The cryptocurrency has continued to soar in value just weeks after hitting $20,000 for the first time.

item.title: Coronavirus: Israel leads vaccine race with 12% given jab
item.description: With more than 1m people inoculated, Israel has by far the highest vaccination rate in the world.

item.title: Garcia stops UK's Campbell after surviving knockdown
item.description: Mexican-American Ryan Garcia gets up from the canvas to stop Britain's Luke Campbell with a body shot in Dallas, Texas.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK sets up more than 20 Covid test sites for France-bound hauliers
item.description: The government said free kits will be offered to companies who want to set up their own test sites.

item.title: Covid-19: Impact on Israel
item.description: The BBC's Tom Bateman spent 2020 following the lives of Israelis affected by the pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I lost my father - and my faith in America'
item.description: After her dad died of Covid, Angelina Proia felt blindsided by his absence and the US's pandemic response.

item.title: Covid-19: How will the pandemic affect global health in 2021?
item.description: From Covid-19 to measles, Smitha Mundasad looks at the health issues facing the world this year.

item.title: Australian surfer Mikey Wright rescues woman from Hawaii waves
item.description: Mikey Wright told the BBC rescuing a woman from 'sharp rocks and waves' on a beach in Hawaii.

item.title: Meet India's lower-caste Hindu priest
item.description: For centuries, priests came only from the highest caste. But Marichamy is part of a push for change.

item.title: NFL's Johnson on aim to make oceans clean
item.description: Cleveland Browns' D'Ernest Johnson says "we need to do a better job at making our oceans clean" as he explains why he is using his shoes to spread awareness of ocean conservation.

item.title: 'We filmed our dad's final months to help people'
item.description: Two brothers make a documentary to show "you can still have a life" with terminal cancer.

item.title: Hundreds of dead birds cover Rome street
item.description: A man has filmed hundreds of birds found dead on a Rome street soon after firework displays in the city.

item.title: Five ways to reduce your carbon footprint
item.description: Climate activists explain how individuals can help reduce their carbon emissions.

item.title: Moscow train carriage helps rehome stray pets
item.description: The Tails and Paws train features posters of dozens of animals in need of a new home.

item.title: Covid: How the war on the virus attacked freedom in Asia
item.description: Lockdowns and harsh laws meant to fight the virus have also seen governments quash dissent.

item.title: Viewpoint: Why Ethiopia and Sudan have fallen out over al-Fashaga
item.description: A border dispute has led to armed clashes, deepening fears about insecurity in the region.

item.title: Mauricio Pochettino is back - but why has he chosen Paris St-Germain?
item.description: Thirteen months after leaving Tottenham, Mauricio Pochettino is back in football. Guillem Ballague looks at why he has taken on the challenge at PSG.

item.title: Covid-19 pandemic: Tracking the global coronavirus outbreak
item.description: Key charts and maps explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to stay positive through the winter
item.description: Tips on how to stay positive through winter 2020-21 - in the Covid-19 pandemic and beyond

item.title: Campbell v Garcia: Instagram fame, Ferraris, Canelo and the gritty win that's missing
item.description: Ryan Garcia has been picked out as the most marketable athlete in boxing but what must the Instagram hit do to win over doubters?

item.title: Was I wrong to fall for a cheating cat?
item.description: Anisa Subedar fell in love with a visiting cat. It wanted attention, so she gave it attention. Then it disappeared.

item.title: India's love affair with classic British motorbikes
item.description: BSA, Norton and Royal Enfield are all owned by Indian firms who want to kickstart the brands.

item.title: Brexit: 'We welcomed the deal like a Christmas present'
item.description: Europeans in the UK, and British people around Europe, explain what Brexit will mean for them.

item.title: Arsenal: From relegation fears to European hopes - how has Arteta turned team's form around?
item.description: With three successive wins in the Premier League, Arsenal look to have turned relegation fears into European hopes once again.

item.title: Real Madrid beat Celta Vigo to go top of La Liga
item.description: Marco Asensio scores one goal and provides an assist as Real Madrid beat Celta Vigo to go top of La Liga.

item.title: Man City boss Guardiola rethinking early retirement
item.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says he may stay in management much longer than he anticipated.

item.title: Are 'telepathic' Kane & Son destined to be the Premier League's best?
item.description: After Harry Kane and Son Heung-min continue their 'telepathic' understanding against Leeds, are they destined to be the Premier League's best ever pairing?

item.title: Five India players isolating after meal in Melbourne restaurant
item.description: Five India players are isolating as a precaution after a video shows them eating indoors at a restaurant in Australia.

item.title: Mourinho 'disappointed' after Tottenham players attend party
item.description: Tottenham manager Jose Mourinho says he is "disappointed" after three of his players breached coronavirus rules by attending a party over Christmas.

item.title: The day the pirates came
item.description: A life on the high seas promised adventure, until a kidnapping turned a young man's life upside down.
